I have GD but don't have to take insulin.  I had it controlled by the diet alone, but then started falling off the wagon and/or just getting worse anyway so they actually started me on glyburide last week.  I just take 5mg once a day in the morning and so far it is helping - although I think it helps too much between breakfast and lunch as I tend to start to get shakey if I don't eat enough carbs between breakfast and lunch.  But I know what I'm feeling and why and just drink a soda and eat something and my sugar comes back up.  My doctor says I'm doing fine with it so far and I no longer have to monitor after every meal - only twice a week now.  But he did tell me yesterday that because of it I will need to deliver between 38-39 weeks - so he is scheduling an induction for June 2nd!!

question: I had my glucose screening early this time around b/c I had GD w/ my last pregnancy.  My numbers this time were 127 and at my appt today the dr said b/c my numbers were so high he wants me to do the one hour over!!!!  So why is he not opting for the 3hr?  Not that I want the 3hr but now I am worried about how I am eating.  I mean dont get me wrong, I eat healthy but I know when I have GD that I can't even eat pasta or bread!!!  Ughhhh.  I just wish my dr could get their stuff straight!!!  And I actually talked to an accupuncturist that suggested I take green kamut.  it is just a powder form of wheat grass actually.  very good for you.  well, it is to help regulate blood sugar and since my dr is not familiar he is not into it.  Has anyone every gone w/ your gut instinct and went against the dr????  Now I ask this w/ an open mind and heart.  I have done tons of things against my drs wishes and most of them were on trying to conceive.  So please dont' think I would do anything that would harm myself or my child.  :)  I am very into alternative medicine and holistic health.  More of a natural way then shooting up insulin if it is possible.
title: Scheduled for Another Gestational Diabetes!!
